edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Effect

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Effect

  • public class Effect
extends java.lang.Object
    Effects provide a way of describing visual artifacts on the screen that do not have a physics aspect, but which otherwise fit into the physics world

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • onRender

        public void onRender(SpriteBatch sb,
                     float delta)
        Every time the world advances by a timestep, we call this code. It updates the particle effect and draws it. NB: User code should never call this.
        Parameters:
        sb - The SpriteBatch to use for rendering
        delta - The time since the last render

      • setRepeat

        public void setRepeat(boolean repeat)
        Indicate whether the effect should repeat after it completes, or if it should stop
        Parameters:
        repeat -

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Indicate whether the effect is active right now or not
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enableTilt the effect, false otherwise

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the effect, so that it starts over

      • getEnabled

        public boolean getEnabled()
        Return the current enabled/disabled state of this Renderable
        Returns:
        The state of the renderable
